title: Definition of Mode
text: The mode of a data set is the most frequent value that occurs in that data set. For instance, for a data set containing the values 1; 1; 2; 3, the mode would be 1 as it appears twice (so has a frequency of 2) while 2 and 3 only appear once in the data set. Let's determine the frequencies of each of the different values to find the mode.

title: Determining Frequency of Selling 3 Cars
text: How many times does selling 3 cars show up in the data set?

title: Determining Frequency of Selling 3 Cars
text: How many of the 65 randomly selected car salespersons said they generally sell three cars?

title: Determining Frequency of Selling 4 Cars
text: How many times does selling 4 cars show up in the data set?

title: Determining Frequency of Selling 5 Cars
text: How many times does selling 5 cars show up in the data set?

title: Determining Frequency of Selling 6 Cars
text: How many times does selling 6 cars show up in the data set?

title: Determining Frequency of Selling 7 Cars
text: How many times does selling 7 cars show up in the data set?

title: Finding the Mode
text: What is the mode? What data point (number of cars sold) showed up the most in the data set?
